history.text: Hi, have you watch Toy Story?
Yes, I have! Have you?
Yeah, I love that it has the voices of Tim Allen and Tom Hanks, they play great together don't you think?
Oh absolutely!  I think it tells a very heart warming tale, a childhood classic for sure.
Yeah, obviously CGI has gotten better since then, but it has a real razzle-dazzle look to it.
I think it is what what makes it a really great film. I also think the heft and believablility Tom Hanks brought to his Woody, really makes the whole film worth while.
Yeah. I never had any cowboy toys growing up really, but I'd have loved to have some space figure like Buzz. What about you?
I also was much more of a space figure kind of kid, I only had a few cowboy action figures, most of which were Woody from the film because I was so inspired by his character.
That's cool. You know, I didn't know that Jim Varney was even in this movie until recently? I really like him though so it was awesome to find out. Who did you like most in Toy Story?
I would have to say Tim Allen as Buzz was my favorite at the time, by as I grew up I learned to appreciate the director John Lasseter. Did you know it was his directing debut?!

I did. He really knocked it out of the park. A lot of stuff works shockingly well in the movie, so he deserves a lot of credit. The glory days of Pixar started strong. But yeah, Buzz is cool too, even as an adult I like the childish charm.
I completely agree, I especially like the scene when Buzz was introduced to the film. It was very creative and a great introduction into the concepts covered by the rest of the film.

Yeah, they did justice to most of the characters despite a pretty large cast. I liked Don Rickles as comedy relief as Mr. Potato Head a lot more than the comic relief from Rex, but Rex was still pretty adorable for his part. Gotta have some broad appeal to different audiences, right?
I think that is what made the film such a success is that they hit such a wide audience without overwhelming the viewer, probably why it did so well in the ratings!

Yeah, for sure. So aside from Buzz and Woody who could obviously carry a story on their own, who would you most watch a spinoff of? I think the green army men could be really entertaining to watch, if they found a way to keep it fresh and interesting for an entire feature.
Oh that would be very amusing, but I always thought a film around Wallace Shawn

Wallace Shawn's character
 would make a great film as well, Rex is really funny!
You can't go wrong with dinosaurs right? I like how Rex kept if feeling light, even with some of the darker stuff with Sid.
He was definitely a nice, bright, relief. I really enjoyed how to film developed into a quest for two enemies to find their way home after being lost. I think that is such a great concept!
A great way to come together, just find common ground against an even worse enemy! Haha. Buzz thinking he was a real toy played well with them being in real danger I thought.
That was by far one of my favorite scenes! What did you think of the great scene with the claw machine?
The CLAW! Yeah I have to admit that those toys of the little three eyed aliens were a lot of stupid childhood fun for me. Something about them.
I love those little things, I'd love to get my hands on one now! It was just such an inspirational film.
Yeah. What about the scene where they fly with the rocket? As a kid I kind of wanted to be buzz right then. Looked like a lot of fun, danger regardless of course.
Oh I was always envious of RC that looked like a wild ride!
I still want a human sized RC car because of that, heh.
haha for sure! I will still always remember the worried look Buzz and Woody gave each other after they say Andy's new best friend, do you?
Yeah, I thought it was a cute clever way to wrap up the movie. The life of a toy beautifully captured.

Absolutely
, thank you for having a conversation with me, have a great day!
